Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen F
Reviews.Content: Very Central, Close to Spanish Steps and just across the road from the Metro station. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Antonello in particular was very helpful giving directions to places of interest and recomending restaurants which were always excellent. We were given a map on arrival and alot of places were within walking distance. Room was spotless and the excellent breakfast was a great plus. Definitely would return and would have no hesitation in recommending it to friends. Also free wifi was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel on Via Veneto”
Reviews.Author: Nathan W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our first trip to Rome, and it was delightful. The staff is extremely helpful and polite. Our room was comfortable with a courtyard view. It is centrally located on the Via Veneto near the Piazza Bernini, and is a short walk from the Spanish Steps, Trevo Fountain and the Villa Borghese. We will stay here again when we return to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Maureen R
Reviews.Content: The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. On arrival they gave us a map and pointed out some of the main attractions which were all within walking distance of the Hotel. Although the Hotel was smaller than it appeared on the website, it was spotlessly clean and was perfect as a base. The Hotel is on a busy street but our bedroom, which had a little balcony, was at the back and was extremely quite. On Easter Saturday evening we were pleasantly surprised to find a basket of small easter eggs had been left in our bedroom!! Only negative - no shampoo or conditioner supplied!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: southern512
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful. Room was fabulous. Great location, 5 mins to Spanish Steps. Definitely would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, silent, and welcoming personnel”
Reviews.Author: Urdle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few step from one of the ofly 2 metro of Rome, AND located centraly enough so that you can visit Rome on foot (By the way, you must NOT skip the "Santa Maria degli Angeli", witch was decorated by Michel-Angelo). We usually went to a monument by metro and came back on foot. The staff is friendly (we were upgraded...), the lift is a bit awkward and slow but we didn't mind. We found the breakfast room beautiful. There is a restaurant attached to the hotel, but well, the street is considered the Rome's "Champs Élysées" so its a bit expensive for what it taste.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: MikeSolo
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, centrally located with friendly staff. Breakfast is standard, nothing special. Safe neighbourhood, so you can come and go at any time.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stylish hotel, staff very kind and helpfull”
Reviews.Author: elisabeth j
Reviews.Content: a family hotel with details in art nouveau architecture, with stylish furniture and breakfast accomodation. Some parts were a bit old, such as the floor tapistry. But everything was kept clean well . At first we had a small room, but as soon as a larger one came free, we were offered to .change, for no extra costs. There was a pleasant atmosphere and friendly and helpfull people everywhere. The neighbourhood was very agreable, near the park surrounding villa Borghese, nearby the metro stop. It was a perfect experience for a reasonable price.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Would come back every time”
Reviews.Author: CatG111_12
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, very cute hotel with a great sense of history. It's within walking distance of every major tourist attraction (quick walk to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps.) We even walked to the Vatican and the Colosseum from the hotel - longer treks, but totally doable. Also, it's right across from the Metro for those who don't like walking as much. The service (including the lovely breakfast each morning) was impeccable and the staff spoke English very well. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, wonderful stay at Hotel Alexandria”
Reviews.Author: debs1236
Reviews.Content: Just back from a long weekend in Rome and stayed at the perfectly located Hotel Alexandria. A hop skip and a jump from the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and walking distance to all the main sites. The staff were pleasant and helpful and our room (although quite small) was clean, tidy and quiet - and i cant complain for the price we paid. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a good base for visiting the sites and not wanting to pay astronomical prices in a flash hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, central location with superb service.”
Reviews.Author: welchstrom
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3 children and I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The location is great- very central & short walking distance to many sites- fountain Trevi, Pantheon, Colesium. Joseph at the front desk was so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alexandra - Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: JillP06
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Rome was outstanding due in large part to the accommodations of the Alexandra Hotel! I expect a lot when I am on vacation. The property was everything I expected and more with quaint, yet noble, old world charm. I was in Europe. I was in ROMA! I was thrilled with the room and the hotel! My aunt and I shared a suite on the 6th floor overlooking the Via Vittorio Veneto. We had our own private balcony and were able to leave the windows open all night to sleep under the stars with the cool Roman breeze. The glorious sound of the church bells were a beautiful way to begin each day! The staff was delightful. Gianrico, Joseph, and the other night manager, (I'm sorry, I never got his name) were very helpful and sincerely accommodating to our lack of Italian language! Our entire stay was magnificent. The water pressure and temperature for the shower was fantastic. The beds were extremely comfortable. The breakfast was lovely. The location of the hotel is outstanding!!! We felt safe, secure, and were so happy to be able to walk to so many fine shops, dining areas, and cafes. There is no question that I would stay at this hotel again if my wish comes true from my coin toss at Trevi Fountain. Arrivaderci, Roma!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon :(”
Reviews.Author: ROYSHOONIT
Reviews.Content: Benefits:Great location in Rome, 20 meters from underground. The Junior staff is Amazing. Cons: The reception Not kind. We ordered over the Internet Upgraded room. We got a room with mold on the walls and Unclean toilet, They changed the room Only After we added money.

Reviews.Title: “A very well located hotel with helpful, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tcdevery
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and as it was low season and we were visiting Rome for a special occasion we were upgraded to a suite at no extra cost. It was a very spacious clean room with a very large bed and good facilities. We were able to access wifi with no problems from our room. The hotel itself is pretty old but clean and in an excellent location, within 10-15 minutes walk of most of the popular attractions and shopping areas. The staff were excellent, very helpful and friendly with really good English. The continental breakfast was good but it is worth noting that they are very accommodating to coeliacs with a great selection of pastries and bread rolls for breakfast. Also, the Alex Cafe at the front of the hotel, while a bit on the pricey side, has a very good gluten free menu. If you are looking for a very well located hotel in Rome at a very good price then I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good position, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: fanharuka
Reviews.Content: Business trip to Rome and I spent 1 night at Hotel Alexandra. Its position is very useful at a waliking distance from Rome old centre: 10 minutes from Trevi Fountain, 10 minutes from Spanish step and right on the famous Via Veneto. Hotel is a little too old fashion for my taste, but rate was ok. Room very small, but clean. Service is honestly very good and all staff is really kind. Breakfast in the average with good product, but nothing special

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alexandra was good”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a good value for the price. Great location. Room was neat and clean and wifi was easily accessed. The lifts were a little slow and it took about 10 seconds before the door opened when the floor was reached - but there were signs inside the lifts exaplaining this and it was not a problem. We ate at the Alex Cafe right outside and had a good meal with 10% discount for hotel guests. My wife would have preferred a tub i the bathroom, but othrwise it was very good. Also, we like the fact that the outlet in the bathroom could be adjusted to 110 or 220 volts. Out room had a balcony right above the Via Veneto, it was great to have a glass of wine on the balcony. Bed was more comfortable than we had at a higher priced hotel in Rome.King sized matterss was very confortable. Breakfast was good, but don't wait until 9AM to go down to eat, as you may have to wait a bit for a table. You do have to climb up 12 steps to get to the lobby from the street. The reading/tv/internet lounge was nice. 20 minute walk to almost all central Rome sites. Easy access to bus/metro/trolley for Roma Pass users - highly recommend to get a week long pass. Overall, a positive experience and I would recommend it to anyone. I would stay there again. It was only 100 ft to the Metro and close to many nice spots.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to base a visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: 12Knocksinna
Reviews.Content: If your ideal holiday hotel is modeled on a Marriott or Sheraton, you should definitely avoid the Hotel Alexandra in Rome. This hotel is in a late 19th century building that has been upgraded but still maintains the style of its past. The wheezy lift that barely makes it to the top of the building is probably the major single addition to the building in recent times. Of course, the stairs are available for those who are energetic… As I stayed in February when Rome experienced its first major snowfall in 25 years I wasn’t concerned with the air conditioning, but it does exist in the rooms and the heating was effective. The rooms are as large as you’d expect in a major city and include cramped but effective bathrooms. I was lucky and got a room on the 6th floor with a splendid view over the rooftops of Rome. The hotel offers free Wi-Fi throughout the building. However, I was only able to log on to the service and maintain a somewhat reliable Internet connection in the lobby. The reception told me that routers are installed on each floor but also admitted that the age of the building and the thickness of the walls make good wireless connectivity a hit and miss affair. Breakfast in the hotel is good and can set you up for a day’s walking around Rome. More substantial meals can be eaten at the restaurants dotted around the hotel. The Alex restaurant is immediately outside and is OK, but a tad expensive (53 euros for 3 ordinary pasta dishes, 3 coffees, and some tap water). I suspect that better food at a more reasonable price can be found elsewhere. The staff is friendly and helpful. I didn’t see anyone have problems communicating as the folks at reception speak good English. While not being located beside any specific attraction (the Trevi Fountains are a short walk away), the Hotel Alexandra is well positioned to serve as a base to access all the major sights in Rome. A metro station on Line A is 100m away from the front door of the hotel and this can be taken to get to places such as the Central Rail Terminus (two stops), Vatican (four stops), or the Coliseum (four stops, including a transfer to Line B at the Central Rail Terminus). Riding the metro is easy. One-euro tickets allowing rides of up to 75 minutes on metro and bus (enough to get anywhere in Rome) can be bought from automatic vending machines in stations. All in all, the Hotel Alexandra is an excellent place to stay for those who want somewhere interesting in the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly ok”
Reviews.Author: Lara888
Reviews.Content: Exellent quality-price relation. Kind and helpful staff. Even breakfast surprisingly good! Definitely to come back!!! Thank you guys:)

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: crthan8608
Reviews.Content: The location was great, close to all, with the metro at your feet, clean hotel, the staff was very kind & gentle, ready to help you, the breakfast was very good but the room we stayed (No.446) needs renovation (especially the bathroom).

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: miq r
Reviews.Content: The location es perfect for tourists. All the staff was nice and helpful (unfortunately we only knew the name of one of the three receptionits, Massimo, but all them were very nice to us).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: zzzaneta
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very easy to find. We got a terravision bus to Termini station from Ciampino airport (€4 one way!) and then got a metro to the hotel. It was only two stops away and the hotel was just accross the street from Veneto metro street exit. The receptionist Joseph was very pleasant and helpful and told us of all different transport possibilities when going to the sites we wanted to visit. The hotel is quite old but it was well worth the price for its location. I booked through their website and paid €65 for one night for 2 people with nice breakfast included (this was a special offer with 15% discount for paying up front). The room and toilet with shower was very small but it was clean and for a couple of us there was definately enough room. There was a minibar in the room which had very reasonable prices. We had dinner in the Alex restaurant (got 10% off as residents). The food was tasty but a little on the expensive side. Glass of wine was €6 but the measure was smaller than in Ireland. There are lots of better choices in the centre. Hotel had 2 PC's with free internet access in the lounge area. The hotels location was excellent as it was just 5 -10 minutes walk from the Trevi fountain and main bar and restaurant area and just across a metro stop. Would recommend it for short city breaks!

Reviews.Title: “Alexandra the Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Bill L
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located for seeing Rome's best sights. The room was a good size, staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Alexandros T
Reviews.Content: Very good location, near metro-bus station, from where you can go everywhere. The room was well decorated and very comfortable. Staff very kind and helpfull. They have answer and advice for everything. Trust them.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel to choose in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: 18Ani18
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, location, service, breakfast, rooms. 20 min walk from Termini (the main Railway Station) and less than 10 min walk to Spanish steps. Room/bathroom were clean and bed comfortable. Got very good night sleep! Breakfast was good with tea/coffee, bread, eggs, fruits etc. And tap water really was drinkable!

Reviews.Title: “nice and kindly”
Reviews.Author: Jimena G
Reviews.Content: We spent a nice time there, the people who work there are very kindly, the hotel is good an the breakfast is abundant!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: sen f
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an unbeatable location, very near Barberini Metro station, the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish steps. The rooms are very stylishly decorated, spacious and comfortable. The staff is excellent, they assisted us with absolutely everything making our trip very enjoyable. Breakfast was also good comparing to other hotels in Italy. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good located, good service”
Reviews.Author: barnagov b
Reviews.Content: Generally very good. No parking close to hotel, car was parked at Excelsior hotel parking.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the money spent”
Reviews.Author: cocojelado
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at Hotel Alexandra on Christmas 2011. We had a double standard room and we paid 90 euro per night with breakfast because I made an early booking and paid all money in advance, I believe the regular price is about 110 euro. We had room 327 which was on the back side of the 3rd floor and had a little balcony. The room size was ok, the room was pretty clean, with TV, a closet, a desk, two chairs and a mini bar. It also had a very good heater (sometimes too hot!). The bathroom was a little small but ok for us, the only problem was the toilet flash which worked just fine but was a little bit noisy (dripping) everytime it was trying to fill up with water. Also the walls were indeed too thin and we could hear almost everything from the room next door.The prices of the drinks, peanuts etc of the mini bar was fine comparing them with the prices in the city of Rome. It had free wi fi but connection was a little difficult, we had to disconnect and reconnect all the time. Finally the entire hotel and the rooms had a weird smell, something like moist. We were very satisfied by the service of the hotel, were all perfect and very helpful with us, provided us with very useful info about the city sights and the metro. Breakfast was pretty good, not very much variety but had the basics. Also it had good filter coffee and you can order espresso too. The location of the hotel is just perfect. Right on via Veneto which is a very beautiful street, too close to Spagna and Fontana di Trevi (5-10 min walk) and you are in walking distance almost from everything. Also the metro stop Barberini which takes you to Vatican in three stops, Spagna, Piazza del Popolo etc is just a few metres from the hotel. Finally one night we had dinner at the Alex cafe-restaurant. The food was great (try the Alex rizotto with shrimps) and the customers of the hotel have a 10% discount. It was quite expensive though, we were 4 persons and we paid for 4 main courses, 1 salad, 2 glasses of wine and 1 coke 100 euro with the discount and after that were still hungry and went for crepes at Fontana di Trevi! Besides the drawbacks my overall experience was good, I believe Hotel Alexandra is a good value for money as all hotels in the centre of Rome are really expensive and not worth the money spent. I suggest it if you are looking for a clean hotel in an excellent location with not too much money spent.

Reviews.Title: “great location hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mona R
Reviews.Content: The Alexandra hotel has a great location, near most of the city sight seeing locations as well as main shopping area. also the train station, a near by travel agent and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “city trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: anna n
Reviews.Content: PROS: 1. good central location 2. subway is nearby 3. clean 4. good breakfast for Italy CONS: 1. there is NO hot water after 8 or 9 pm. we lived in the 1st floor and in the evening after the whole day of walking there was barely warm water available. when we complained, the staff didn't manage to help us and just said that the boiler is in the 6th floor so we have to wait a bit until the hot water comes. unfortunately, it didn't happen... 2. uncomfortable bed! mattress was terrible! 3. very dry air in the room 4. thin walls, we could hear everything what our neighbors were doing 5. noisy street outside, cannot open the window 6. cleaning person didn't leave paper napkins in the bathroom 7. the hotel is affiliated to the restaurant Alex with 10% discount, but after reading the reviews we decided not to eat there. 8. small room

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Greg D
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect. Staff was very helpful. The breakfast was about right. The only slide problem was the room's heating. It was too hot and we could not open the window due to noise from Via Veneto. Also, the elevator is slow so you may have to wait a while until you can get it. Overall is a very good choice

Reviews.Title: “Breif Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: frank w
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel centrally located in ROME, with a European breakfast. Roomy room for a European hotel, with very slow elevator Room decor was very plain

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Break”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: Our room was small but adequate and clean. I liked the breakfast room with its coloured glass wall. It is situated in a very attractive street leading to Villa Borghese with a Metro stop nearby allowing you to reach the Vatican in a few minutes. My abiding impression was of the friendly and helpful staff on the front desk and for that reason I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend city trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Fenella204
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel with friendly staff and good welcome. We had a very spacious room and the hotel is extremely central for sightseeing and shopping. We liked the fact it wasn't too modern inside.

Reviews.Title: “5 Great days in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Rui A
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is great! Near barberini square there is a Metro station in a few meters. In the same street there are lot's of great hotel's as well as the Hard Rock Café in Rome. Rome is a great city to visit all year long! Don't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: carlalubranopires
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its location. As I walked a lot I went to all the places I wanted. The only thing I would like to say regarding the hotel is about breakfast. Should have more variety of food (and I only stayed at the hotel for 3 nights). One of the days I went later and there wasn't enough food for all the people that were arriving... My room was small but for me was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alexandra, wonderful memory!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn K
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at this hotel, very friendly staff, clean and spacious rooms, good breakfast! Will definitely return !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alexandra is in probably in the best location for seeing the sights of Rome. We were upgraded to a Deluxe Room which looked onto Via Vittorio Veneto, because of this it was noisy most noticeably in the early hours of the morning in the hotels defence there was roadworks going on. The room was a resonable size and the mini bar is the cheapest we have ever come across, the service was okay. The adjoining Cafe was fantastic great food and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Happy holiday in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Hazel M
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were delighted with the location of the hotel as we could easily walk everywhere and there are plenty of good local restaurants for dinner. We were upgraded to a junior suite which was spacious and very comfortable. The staff were very helpful and friendly and we thoroughly enjoyed our breakfast and the Italian habit of cake. We would be happy yo stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Enrico R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel on 2nd of November. The central position is fantastic if you have business in central Rome (the tube station is also 50m from the entrance) and of course if you are a tourist you can walk to some of the best sites in the city! Rooms are very clean and have a nice "home" feeling, even if not particularly large. Service is very courteous and efficient

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and terrific staff.”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at this Hotel and the room was terrific. The staff was very friendly and helpful with our requests. The breakfast that was included with our room was more than adequate and saved us money overall. Rome is a very expensive city and it was nice not to have to exit the Hotel to find a morning meal. The items in the mini-bar where priced much less than street side. The location is near most of the cities main sites and sits in the heart of the best shopping Rome has to offer. One of my favorite places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty place, NOT accessible to everyone.”
Reviews.Author: Imbethanntoo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was pretty, but at the entrance you are greeted by a stairway of ~20 stairs with all of your luggage. Then, for my room, I had to go up another 1.5 flights of stairs to get to my room. They have an elevator (once you get up the 20 stairs to reception) but I was told the elevator didn't go to my floor, so expect to either drag your luggage or tip someone else heavily for doing it for you. Rooms were large including the bathroom, bed was okay and it was quiet. Overall it was a good room but if you're traveling with folks who can't negotiate stairs, do NOT stay here. Breakfast was common and they have really small conference rooms (less than 30) so if you need something bigger than that, you can't use this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good - not great”
Reviews.Author: MaijaMatkaaja
Reviews.Content: The location was definately the best part of the hotel. Pictures on the hotel website are misleading to say the least. Clean but very basic in terms of room quality and size. Breakfast was a disappointment - definately an improvement area. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was very hot and poorly airconditioned - even in October.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MPBN
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for a 5 night stay and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is clean and comfortable. Bathroom was a little small, but adequate nonetheless. The best part of our stay was the assistance we got from the front desk staff. Antonelli (has a passion for cooking and dining) steered us to some great restaurants. He made the reservations and we enjoyed them all. The other front desk people were great also and made things very simple for us by calling cabs when needed and offering advice about how to get places. Nice place to stay and we will stay there again if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Italian luxury? American Comfortable...sorta”
Reviews.Author: Imready2dream
Reviews.Content: Great Location!! This cannot be denied with this hotel property. We found it to be ideal for first time vistors to Rome. We could walk to all the sights and take a new route everyday and find something new and interesting to see, shop or eat at. Tony at the front desk is very friendly and helpful with recommending local favorite restaurants. If you do decide to take the Leonardo DaVinci train in from the airport to Termini station, I recommend you take a cab from the Termini train station, if you are hauling around luggage. The walk to the metro is very long and full of stairs--which is tiresome to lug your bags up and down after a long flight. The hotel graciously offers a complimentary breakfast. The cafe/espresso and yogurt are fabulous--the rest--yukky! There are cold cereals and pastries, The service at the breakfast is hit or miss--depending upon how busy the dining room is. Forget the hot dishes if you are American, because they are bland, cold, runny and scary. We did find a local restaurant on Via Sistina, a super short walk from the hotel called Ristorante Leon D'Oro. Fabulous homemade pasta and anti-pasta dishes in an intimate setting offering reasonably priced cuisine. Our room was roomy by Rome standards, but not comfortable for relaxing in after a long day of walking & touristing. There were no comfortable sitting chairs/ottomans and the bed is ROCK hard--very European from what we were told. Also, the noise from Via Veneto will remind you of a busy street in New York City. It was hard sometimes to sleep through the night because of the ongoing noise (bring ear plugs if you get a room over this street). For transportation back to Fioucimino Airport I recommend a transport company called www.airportshuttle.it. The most reasonable cost we found for return shuttle transportation to the airport--31Euro for the both of us. I liked the Hotel Alexandra, but knowing what I know now about how much you will walk in Rome and how important it is to have a comfortable, good night sleep to keep pace for the next busy day, I would spend a few more Euro and choose a hotel that has increased comfort/functionality-more American style room--yep I said it, a room with a bit more luxury and in a perfect world a few more English speaking TV channels. I would also visit Rome in the OFF Tourist Season. That's just our preference...everyone is different, so when in Rome, do as the Romans-Prego! Oh and avoid touring the Vatican/St. Peter's Basilica on Monday---SUPER CROWDED, HOT AND BUSY.

Reviews.Title: “convenient, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AKS994
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and tastefully decorated. Comfy bed and nice bathroom. All very compact- not much storage and breakfast not up to much. Very pleasant helpful staff. Really handy for SpanishSteps, Trevi, Villa Borghese Park + not far to Termini and Forum. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: CTCOUPLE137
Reviews.Content: I must start by saying that this was our first trip to Rome, and we booked this independent tour through Gate 1 travel. Having traveled before with Gate 1, we expected the accommodations to be outstanding and we were not disappointed. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a very pleasant and helpful gentleman, Carlo. He immediately tended to the formality of checking us in and saw to it that our luggage was promptly delivered to our room. We stayed in room 327 which actually faced the inner courtyard and was very quiet. The room had everything we needed for a very comfortable stay. Most importantly, it was clean with a very comfortable double bed, ample storage space for unpacking, a small fridge, a desk, and a balcony. After a long day of exploring the sights and sounds of Rome it was a nice feeling to know that you were coming back to a welcoming smile. All of the staff we encountered, especially Carlo and Tony, were extremely helpful and friendly, but Carlo, in our opinion, went above and beyond to make sure that we were content. He made restaurant recommendations to Alex, restaurant, affiliated with the hotel, and Ciro pizza and both were excellent. The location of this hotel is superb, and we found it to be the perfect jumping off point whether on foot or by Metro. The hotel is nicely decorated with beautiful sitting rooms as well as a lovely area for the buffet style breakfast, and it was very apparent that this hotel was rich in history. Our only regret...we only stayed three days, but if given the opportunity we would return here in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Good location in a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: joeriz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on the via veneto. The location was great as was the front desk staff. However, the rooms were totally unacceptable. The ac did not work for the first day or so, the room was darkand dreary. It felt dusty. Hardwood floors were worn and had nails sticking up. Bad experience. Would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: AnnD911
Reviews.Content: My son and I traveled to Paris and Rome through Air-France Holidays and this was the assigned hotel. From the check-in to our (very) early morning check-out, we greatly enjoyed our time at this lovely hotel. It is VERY convenient to walking all over central Rome and also VERY close to the Metro Barberini station. The front desk attendants were always helpful with our questions and arranged a cab to get us to the airport which was prompt, fast and friendly. Our room was beautiful in an old world tradition with a small balcony overlooking the back courtyard, small TV, mini-fridge and ample closet space. The bathroom was to-die for - all marble, glass shower wall and bidet. I'm sorry I don't have a picture, it was so pretty. Though the room was small by American standards it felt like a piece of old Europe. The hotel is apparently made up of several buildings as there were stairs leading up to our level. Another section had an elevator. There is a set of stairs up from the street to enter the hotel. The rooms that we saw were very individual and different and I'm sorry I don't recall the number of our room. The conservatory used for the continental breakfast which was included, had stained glass, small tables for 4 and was very clean and pretty. The food was typical - various fruits and meats, breads and rolls, juices and coffee and tea. Very adequate to get you going. We had a great time at this hotel. It is so convenient to most attractions either walking or by Metro, I wouldn't want to stay in any other area. The staff were helpful, the room was clean and comfortable, the City is Amazing. Can't wait to go back!! ...and we'll stay at Hotel Alexandra!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, Good location”
Reviews.Author: vegebrarian
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Room was adequately sized and clean, shower was large (by European hotel standards) but the toilet and bidet were too snug against the wall. Breakfast was a nice buffet style, cheese, croissants, meat, wieners, breads, cakes, hard boiled eggs and jams (avoid the "scrambled eggs"). Free wifi and 2 pcs in the lobby where a real convenience. Not too far from the Spanish Steps and lots of restaurants and shops. Metro is literally a block away. Customer services was great. They were helpful and pleasant. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: Judi W
Reviews.Content: We were given a really lovely room. Very spacious and well appointed. Staff couldn't have been more helpful or pleasant. A great position within walking distance to many attractions. We chose to eat at the Alex resturant twice because again, the staff were wonderful and the food far superior to any of the eateries close by. Our meals were delicious. The Hotel Alexandra was the perfect choice for accomodation to end our month overseas.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Teresa C
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Alexandra in mid September 2011. Good quiet location, close to the Spanish steps, Trevi fountain and a metro station and bus stop just a few yards away. Hotel staff seemed pleasant and helpful. Good choice at breakfast although a better selection of fresh fruit would have been good! Room was clean and quite spacious ( a bonus from the room in Venice!!) although could have benefited from a little updating with the decor. Air conditioning was efficient and a good choice of channels on the T.V.The wi fi was also free! Slept really well here probably due to all the walking around the sights and the 320 steps to the top of St. Peters at the Vatican. Be wary of "Roman soldiers" at the Colosseum - 10euro each for photos! and people helping with luggage/directions at the termini station - IT WILL COST YOU!!

Reviews.Title: “good localisation but bad experience”
Reviews.Author: kajam60
Reviews.Content: We booked for a double.quiet room 3 months in advance. Got a small room,facing the main street.The bed was hardly for one person.We were offered a larger room for extra 40 euro a night.Quite arrogant staff.Never again there.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday trip”
Reviews.Author: HAC51
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect for visiting all the sights. Very close to the metro but you can easily walk to most places if you are energetic. Came here with my husband and four friends to celebrate my 60th birthday. On arrival we were told we had been double booked for the first night and so had to stay in the Imperiali next door but this was not really a problem as our luggage was transferred for us the next morning. The staff are all very helpful especially Joseph on reception. The rooms were a good size and there was no noise from the traffic despite being on the popular Via Veneto. My only disappointment was that we asked for a restaurant recommendation for my birthday dinner and asked for somewhere vegetarian but we were booked into a fish restaurant which was totally unsuitable !! however I would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to return here next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very minor issues.”
Reviews.Author: S T
Reviews.Content: Pros: Perfect location on a safe and nice main street. Metro is just steps away but most attractions are walking distance. Staff was friendly and accomodating. Bathroom was spacious. Room and grounds were clean. Air conditioning worked well. Cons: No early check-in option, so if you're traveling long distance expect to not be able to check-in until 2:00pm. My wife and I never had hot water between 8:30 and 10:30 in the morning, so we had to shower at night or late in the day. Rooms have obvious wear and tear and dont look like the pictures on their website. Beds are not comfortable, though thats the way most European hotels are (our double bed was 2 twin beds pushed together). No in-room safe, though we did not have any safety concerns.

Reviews.Title: “Good location friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Erwin S
Reviews.Content: Remembered seeing the hotel during one of our previuos trips to Rome-never stayed in it before . i was accompanied by my wife and another couple -we chose it this time because of its excellent location - walking distance from the main attractions including the shopping area near the Spanish steps.We encountered very friendly and efficient staff -starting with the man in the reception whose name i unfortunately don't remember and Stanislav the porter- got one of the best rooms in the hotel on the second floor(262) without directly asking.The room was spatious and clean . There was some traffic noise which was easily masked by keeping the air condition on. There is also an efficient valet parking service. Overall a very positive 'excellent experience- will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday in Rome”
Reviews.Author: James T
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent and all the major attractions were within walking distance. We had a private transfer both to and from the hotel, where the transport was on time and the driver friendly. The balcony on our room was a great addition, where we had a panoramic view of Via Veneto and our thanks to Carlos at reception for being friendly and welcoming. We would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Was robbed in the room”
Reviews.Author: taisha1971
Reviews.Content: during the night, my friend and myself,must have been an inside job,spend the day after filing police report instead of visiting the Pantheon, hotel provided transport free of charge to the airport,must hand them that but still waiting to hear from their insurance

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Calabrisella5
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel alone is worth the stay. Located on Via Veneto, it's about a 5 to 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps, directly in front of Barberini Fountain and also within walking distance to other sites and tons of shops, Just outside of the hotel you can find the Barberini metro stop, which makes it easy to get to Termini train station and connect to the airport. If you have heavy luggage you may be better off getting a taxi from Termini to the hotel. As a solo traveler, I felt completely safe at all times in this area and in the hotel The room was comfortable and staff was helpful. I was told by locals that it may be the best quality for inexpensive hotels on Via Veneto ( I paid about $110 a night during mid August for a solo room). Wonderful price for its location. The breakfast buffet (which was included) could have had more of a selection.

Reviews.Title: “good air conditioning, nice room, good location”
Reviews.Author: rayl33
Reviews.Content: This was a good value. Our room was always nice and cool and I liked the clean, chipper white decor. The double bed was, as usual in Italy, actually two hard twin beds pushed together. The breakfast was okay; the eggs were very runny and one day, we each took 2 boiled eggs only to discover that all 4 of the eggs were raw. You need to request coffee or a cappucino; it is not out and available. There is not really a good fresh fruit selection, but more the fruit cocktail. The hotel has one computer that is often occupied and is very slow. I spent about 45 minutes writing an email with repeated appearances of the hourglass only to have the entire internet connection close on me. The location is nice, on a street of restaurants and cafes, and peaceful inside. It is not a short walk to the Trevi fountain and you are very near the Spanish Steps and several boutiques.

Reviews.Title: “Still my favorite place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sml41
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel last summer and again in July, 2011. I love the location of this hotel for its location to all the popular spots, Trevi, Spanish Steps, even a little bit of a walk to the Vatican, close to designer stores if you want to window shop, close to the colosseum, tomb of the unknown soldier, a little bit of a walk to the Bocca Della Verita, close to bus stops, metro, etc. Some of the hotel rooms have some age to them and probably could use a minor facelift. That is not all the rooms and the front desk was very helpful in changing my room to my satisfaction. The personnel have always been helpful and pleasant on both visits. I might make the recommendation to upgrade their pillows but after staying in different places in Greece, it seems to be something more common in all hotels not just this one. The other suggestion would be for the hotel to change their breakfast menu a bit; it is always the same, including the same cakes, etc. I am sure in Italy, there must be some other selections to impress the guests once in a while. Other than those minor suggestions, I don't have any complaints. I would stay again and look forward to my next visit to Rome and the Hotel Alexandra

Reviews.Title: “Tale of two hotels”
Reviews.Author: Mfest19
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Alexandra for four nights based on a recommendation that this hotel was an affordable, quality hotel in the heart of Rome. You have to be very careful with this hotel as the rooms are not equal. We booked a standard double room back 6 months before coming and the first room we were put in should not be classified as a double. The bathroom was beyond small and had mildew stains on the ceiling. The bed was uncomfortable and small. We requested a room change the next day and were offered another standard double room. The difference was night and day. The bathroom was double the size and. Clean. The bed and room were bigger and cleaner and for the rest of our stay we were fine with the room. My reason for only giving 2 stars is that the hotel should not be charging the same rate for rooms that are clearly far apart in quality. My wife and I do not consider ourselves to be snobby in terms of what we expect in rooms overseas. We understand that in big cities real estate is expensive (especially in via veneto in Rome) and that you should not expect 2000 square feet. However, there is no reason to have rooms at the same rate with such differences in quality. If you have booked this hotel for your stay, be warned to check your room before you stay. Our first room was 214 and I suspect that rooms around that area are of similar "quality" On the plus side, the hotel is centrally located: close to the Spanish steps, subway and bus stops and the second room was fine for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “That's Amore!”
Reviews.Author: SouxieC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first three days of our honeymoon to Rome and Sorrento. It was exceptionally clean and the bed was comfy. When we saw how bustling the city was and how many mopeds there were we thought we'd never sleep but the hotel was quiet and peaceful. Rome is amazing and this is the perfect place to stay. The steps to the metro are a few steps away so perfect for exploring this glorious city. The staff were friendly and helpful - a fab three star! We almost stayed at a four star which didn't have as good reviews so we are happy we didn't! Thank You Alexandra for the perfect start to our wonderful Italian honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Leemoz71
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and slept like a baby. The hotel is on a busy street but the double glazing works a treat.to say it's a 3* is a joke as looking at 4*s in Rome there's no comparison. The staff was friendly and breakfast was good (best scrambled egg ) all in all top hotel. Walking distance to history.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother Getting a Standard Room”
Reviews.Author: DemandingGuest
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms, one was Deluxe the other was called Standard. The Deluxe room was large and comfortable. The Standard (we could get another Deluxe) was so small it was was laughable. The room was barely big enough for the bed, and when we put our luggage in the room there was no place to walk. The bathroom was amazingly small. I didn't know a toilet would fit in such a small space. The shower was only 3 ft by 1.5 feet. When I dropped the soap I had to get out of the shower stall in order to reach down to pick it up. There wasn't enough room in the stall to bend over. Finally, because of the shower's diminutive size, there was no way to prevent the water from spraying out onto the bathroom floor, so it was always flooded after a shower. Otherwise, it is a clean hotel with an adequate breakfast (nothing great), and it is in a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable base from which to view Rome”
Reviews.Author: jamesr_richards
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Alexandra for 3 nights in May as part of a 3-location honeymoon in Italy. The location is no more than 5 minutes walk to the Spanish steps towards the north of the centre, but all of the main sights are within walking distance. There is also a Metro station literally outside the hotel, which we used to cross the river and go to St Peter's square. We had a basic room, with a small bathroom and a TV with various satellite channels. The breakfast served in the morning was fine, without being anything over the top. The only one minor criticism was the attitude of some (not all) of the reception staff, but this was far from a major problem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for biking tour, shoppping and dining!”
Reviews.Author: Inger95
Reviews.Content: Friendly service Good breakfast Very good location A good night sleep

Reviews.Title: “We will always stay at the Alexandra Hotel when we are in Roma”
Reviews.Author: DianneKeith
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the famous Veneto district of Rome, close to the Spanish Steps and a short Metro trip from the main Station. We could walk to everything, including the Colliseum. The "Alexandra" is not Holiday Inn, but it has charm and atmosphere. We asked for "una camera tranquila, per favore" and were given a lovely room with its own terrace. The choice of pavement cafes just outside was great. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: MandyBurns09
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I recently stayed at the Alexandra Hotel and we couldnt be more pleased. The hotel was very clean and tidy the staff so helpful and would do anything to assist you. We decided we would like to change rooms and the help we got from reception was fantastic especially Carlos - so helpful. The location of the hotel is second to non - perfect for all main sites and the metro. We caught the metro to the Coliseum and decided to walk back which in fact only took us at a leisurely pace 45 minutes and some stunting sites whilst walking back. The gotel has its owm restaurant placed outside and the food & service was execellant and we received 10% discount for staying at the hotel. Overall thoroughly enjoyed the hotel & Especially Rome - what a beautiful city. If you are looking for a centrally located hotel this has got to be the one. l

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: grasyl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexandra for four nights in May and found it to be a good, clean hotel. The location is great with all the sights close enough to walk for us, but the metro is very close for those who prefer. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room and bathroom were small but immaculately clean and, bearing in mind that we looked out on to the Via Veneto, remarkably quiet - very good double glazing. Breakfast was limited but adequate - more hot choice would be nice. Plenty of restaurants close by to suit all tastes and costs. We found one just round the back of the hotel - two minutes walk away - which was very good and reasonably priced - La Botte -very friendly and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rome, shame about the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jwith
Reviews.Content: We arrived mid afternoon and were greeted by the reception who was aghast at the fact we had walked from the Termini to the hotel, little did we know the Metro was 20 metres away from the hotel and only costs 1euro, whic h we used alot on our stay. We were tired after being up since 3.00am to get to the airport for 5.00am for the 7.00am flight so we were ready to drop on a comfy bed. We were shown a room on the first floor which was clean and presentable with a good sized bathroom opening balcony doors that gave a not too enspiring view on an inner court yard and drab rear views of other properties. To say we were disappointed is a little of an understaement but as we were only here for three days we decided against complaining for another room and we would put up with the room as it should be quiet at night (whiuch it was very quiet). Reception staff were generally very good especially Carlos, we never found out the name of another one which is probably a good thing as we haven't anything good to say about him. Breakfast was adisappoinment to say the least, we are used to continental but this was even less then that, not a good selection and not much choice, no toast machine, and only one staff member serving which became mayhem when the number of tables began to fill. We noticed on the weekend that the staff numbers increased presumably to cope with the hotel having more guests staying, which isn't good for the guests who came in the week. The hotel is very well placed for all the main attractions and the Metro covers the rest, we walked evreywhere having reviving coffees when we were flagging in the surprising hot weather we didn't anticipate for this time of year which helped for a very pleasurable time in Rome. We are defintiely returning having thrown our coins in the Trevi fountain but we will be more careful with our choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for clean hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: NoreenM1023
Reviews.Content: Upon entry, we advised the staff that we were there for our honeymoon - Immediately, the manager came out to welcome us and offer a complimentary bottle of champagne. When we ventured to all of the sightseeing stops, we were either a short walk or a quick Metro stop away. The staff were very helpful in guiding us to where we needed to go. They also had great suggestions for restaurants and bars for our evenings there.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: TazzaT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a terrific location, except for the grumpy bellboy, the Reception Staff were excellent; even upgraded our room, and gave us some great tips of places to eat. There is a lift, squeezy, but adequate, breakfast was included with the rate. The rooms are a little tired but we would probably stay here gain.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms but a woderful location”
Reviews.Author: peter202
Reviews.Content: Located on Via Veneto, the hotel was 30 metres from Barberini metro station and had bus stops only 10 metres away. The hotel was comfortable and the staff were all friendly and helpful but the rooms were tiny, at least ours was and we had a balcony room. There was less than 50cms between the foot of the bed and the wall. We had to take turns going from one side of the room to the other. Breakfast was a buffet and although not the best that I have had, it was adequate and the very hard working dining room staff were very polite and pleasant. The proximity of the Metro and the buses was wonderful, we were able to go wherever we wanted cheaply and quickly and never had to use taxis. We do plan to go to Rome again, probably next year and just might stay at the Alexandra again. However, whatever hotel we choose, must have the excellent transport links that the Alexandra had.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel room we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: MamaSolomon
Reviews.Content: BE WARNED – this isn’t even a 2 star hotel! The rooms throughout vary tremendously in size, vintage, and noise level. Ours was VERY shabby, not at all chique & intolerably noisy! We have traveled the world, stayed in all types of hotels, and understand and respect local differences in standards. That said, this might be the worst hotel room we have ever stayed in. We arrived with 2 other couples, all experienced travelers, all paying the same rate. We all changed rooms at least once after check-in, as the original rooms were so bad (we heard others doing the same). One couple said they eventually got a room that was nice, one said theirs was just barely OK, and they were all absolutely appalled when they saw our room. It looked like an old grandma’s room that hadn’t been updated in many decades - very depressing. It had dingy, stained wallpaper with holes and tears ALL over, bare hardwood floors so deeply worn and rough it was dangerous to walk barefoot, bathroom tile floor chipped up, wood doors & trim paint peeled, chipped, and discolored with age. Furniture was old and dilapidated (some antique, but in need of repair). The shower had a rusty door-frame, the door clumsily replaced by a curtain that fell down when showering. Most unbelievable were the 3 old fashioned (fabric wrapped) electrical chords coming up the wall and hung over the top of headboard, with little switches duck-taped to them - literally hanging over our heads when we laid in bed. And the window opened to a very nice street, but noisy (all night long) beyond anything we have ever experienced. Although warm weather had arrived in Rome, the air conditioners had not been turned on. Shutting the windows meant suffering in a hot room all night. This was our second room. The first was so small that 2 people couldn’t pass each other. It had a double bed with about 2 feet to the wall and to a closet at the foot of the bed. When my husband said “where’s the TV?” The bellman said “It’s in the closet” it was - a little flat screen TV along with an almost empty minibar. This room wasn’t so shabby, and was very quiet and breezy with the window open, but it was so claustrophobic that the larger, shabby room looked appealing to us. The woman at the front desk did her job, but sure "had an attitude", as did the breakfast staff. The breakfast was there, but was mediocre, at best. This hotel may look good on paper, with all the “amenities” but the reality is far different! And it ALL depends on which room you get.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chips21
Reviews.Content: Nice and cosy hotel with nice people taking care of it. Very good cleaning of the room and very good breakfast. The only bad thing is the bed which really need to be changed. Also, the standard double room (economic) is really small. Otherwise, it is a very well localised, very closed to everything. I would recommend this hotel. Thank you for all the team.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,best hotel bed in Rome”
Reviews.Author: tgstaffs
Reviews.Content: TThey say location is everything and the Hotel Alexandra scores top marks being located on the via Veneto which is walking distance to many of the major attractions in the city. The room was well furnished with the bed being absolutely superb,I can't rate it highly enough. Service was good with friendlyand helpful staff. The breakfast buffet was good but with limited hot food. Overall a great place to enjoy Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: John1701D
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an awesome stay. The hotel is within easy walking distance of many major attractions and also just yards from the metro station. The staff was very helpful and allowed us to check in early which was very appreciated. Our room, 333, was HUGE. A separate sitting area, a large bedroom with a king size bed, a chest of drawers and an armoire. A large clean restroom with very hot water...and my first experience with a bidet. :-) The free breakfast spread was more than adequate, with meats, cheeses, pastries, and cereal. There were also attendants to serve you coffee. We couldn't be more pleased and will certainly stay here if we make it back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best in Rome”
Reviews.Author: meekin
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked this hotel in December but due to snow and inclement weather were forced to rearrange. We eventually stayed in March and the weather was marvellous. Our original upgrade room may have been better but the room we had at the front of the hotel was awful. Staff are offhand and not very helpful. We found all the sites ourselves as the major sites are all within walking distance or via the nearby Metro. Cafe Restaurant was very good with typical Rome prices and the included breakfast was adequate. Shower room (no bath)/toilet was so small anyone even slighly overweight would have a problem. Toilet and bidet were not screwed to the floor and made visits eventful. I would not recommend this hotel except fro the fact that it was very central. Pay the extra to enjoy for somewhere better, anywhere reallt. Incidentally if you do visit keep extra cash for the final bill which includes city tax, which is a surprise to some visitors to this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel staff in an excellent location among luxury hotels and close to major cultural sites.”
Reviews.Author: cat2thai
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alexandra is truly a hidden gem (although not really hidden as its location is among the best) - walking distance to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Piazza di Popolo, Villa Borghese, Colloseum, Pantheon, Piazza Navona. Close to restaurants and great gelato shop.

Reviews.Title: “Good position for sight seeing , friendly helpful service”
Reviews.Author: Frandango123
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay - staff were welcoming and helpful and we could walk easily to many of the sights of Rome. The bed was comfortable and the room was very clean - the only slight criticism was the size of the bathroom - shower very small! Also it would have been helpful to have had some drawers for clothes - one large cupboard provided to hang things in. The hotel is situated on a busy road so it was quite noisy with any window open but this was o.k. for us as we really wanted to be able to walk from the hotel to sight see. Breakfast was well organised - and food was well presented but in 4 days there was no change in the menu.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service but beware of stairs with luggage & kids”
Reviews.Author: beachlvrca62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Alexandra in Rome and the service was good but the setup of the hotel was very odd and the fact that it had an elevator is misleading as you must climb steep stairs to reach the lobby and once in the hotel, after you get off the elevator, there are stairs you must go down and then back up to reach some of the rooms (ours!). Needless to say, with a family we don't travel light and we look for hotels with elevators on purpose but this hotel had more stairs than most hotels that don't advertise elevators! For people who travel light, the location was incredible as it's around the corner from the Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Helpful staff, and very clean”
Reviews.Author: Mykmarquez
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome so we were very happy our agent booked this hotel. It is in a great location - close to great food, metro, Spanish Steps, and shopping. The location is the best part, very safe. The room was small (Euro as expected), but very clean. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The breakfast was good overall and extremely convenient. We will definitely be staying again for our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Small plain, clean rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jeerikson
Reviews.Content: This was a clean hotel in a great location. We had a standard double room which was nothing like the room pictures shown on the web. Ours was very small and plain, but clean. The staff was absolutely great. The hotel is within 100 yards of the Metro. Noisy at night with the windows open, but being downtown, that is to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Birgitte_11
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with great location, Trevi Fountaine and Spanis Stairs in walking-distance. Nice neibourghood, very close to the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful desk clerk,Antonello, answered our many questions and was extremely helpful during our stay.”
Reviews.Author: travelingteacher48
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located in an area where we could eat cheaply, catch the bus or subway easily or change money quickly. I would stay here again if we have the services of Antonello who helped with directions, using the internet, and in carrying our bags down very early one morning.

Reviews.Title: “Right where we wanted to be”
Reviews.Author: BizDev
Reviews.Content: Rome is such a diverse and sprawling place so a distance of only a few hundred yards gives you a totally different perspective. I had visited Rome before and stayed near the Villa Borghese. The hotel was nice, but the neighborhood was off the beaten path and -- for a traveler -- pretty sterile. The Alexandra was neither of these things. It's located in a vibrant neighborhood just steps from the Barbarini metro stop and very near good, but not designer quality or price shopping. The location makes it possible to get nearly anywhere in downtown Rome easily and there are lots of cabs on Barbarini. It is also very near some superb gelato (Whites)! We enjoyed the Alexandra restaurant, which is a glassed in cube on the street, but it's only open for dinner. There are numerous moderately priced restaurants in walking distance. The wine at the better restaurants as well as the bread were excellent (this is Italy where wine and bread tend to be very good most everywhere). We found lots of variety and did not have a bad meal at any of the restaurants that we visited near the Alexandra. We found the staff very knowledgeable, friendly, and universally fluent in English. Our room was small, but no smaller than urban hotels that I have stayed in while visiting various cities. There have been reports of difficulting in sleeping due to traffic noise. We didn't have a front of the hotel room, but we didn't hear any excessive traffic noise while in the lobby, even on the weekend. The plates covering a street repair were gone when we were there. I would definitely give this hotel a thumbs up. It is a real bargain

Reviews.Title: “Barberini Metro station and Via Veneto shops adjacent”
Reviews.Author: myoshi
Reviews.Content: The location made all the difference in the world for getting around the City and visiting the sites. Staff was friendly and helpful and readily assisted us in making dinner reservations and even spotting the best shopping places. The rooms were clean and efficiently sized, i.e. we didn't have to walk sideways thru the room. Breakfast fare was continental "+" with the usual pastry, breads, meats, cereal and with great caffe. Close to both the nice (small menu pasted to inside of the window) and the below average touristy (one's with the guys outside inviting you in)restaurants. Great shops close by along the Via Veneto. Short walking distance to Borghese Museuem, Spanish steps and Trevi fountain. 20 steps to Barberini metro station. NO complaints based upon our visit...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Jaxtraveler57
Reviews.Content: My mom, my sister & I recently traveled to Rome, Italy (December 13-16, 2010) and had the opportunity to have stayed at Hotel Alexandra. We used a travel agency and during our booking the trip, they had suggested this 3 star hotel on Via Veneto. When we got in Rome, while in the airport, we were a little skeptical on how our hotel would look like. When we got to the hotel, we were amazed and it really exceeded our expectations. The lady at the front desk(tall with long, straight black hair) Sabrina (?) who took care of us during check-in was very accomodating and knowledgeable, communicated to us in good English. The bellboy/bellhop was very friendly, too and communicated to us in English as much as he could. The night front desk gentleman, Joseph, was also very helpful, too. We had a junior suite and it was more than spacious, clean and had adequate light. The patrician motif decor was pleasing to the eyes.The beds were firm, which were good for our aching backs (from walking all day!); the bathroom was clean. Great housekeeping staff and gave us what we requested without any issues. The hotel's location was also a plus! It is just minutes away from areas of interests such as the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps and shopping area with name brand stores (e.g. Louis Vuiton), metro/subway station and Hard Rock Cafe & not to mention, a few minutes away from the US Embassy. One set-back for us was the stair steps that one has to climb up from the main entrance up to the main door to the lobby, since my mom has to walk with a cane and has difficulty with climbing up stairs. The breakfast selection was decent, although because of our hectic schedule, we only tried it for one morning. Good banquet staff. The front desk also offered us a 10% discount when we dined at the restaurant across, the Alex Restaurant, which was helpful. Overall, our stay at Hotel Alexandra was very pleasant and the hotel really exceeded our expectations. We will definitely come back and stay at this hotel again when the opportunity for a visit to Rome comes up, again. I definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel at a great location.”
Reviews.Author: marty0269
Reviews.Content: On the Via Veneto close to the Trevi Fountain and the Villa Borghese. One block from the Metro gave us easy access to all the must see sights in Rome. The hotel is clean, quiet and quite luxurious. The included breakfast made this hotel a terrific bargain. We will definitely come back any time we go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in a perfect location of Rome”
Reviews.Author: rumag7733
Reviews.Content: My travel agent reccomended this hotel, I read the reviews and although I thought the location was great I was not sure about the quality of the hotel. My agent had just visited the hotel while vacationing in Rome and assured me I would be pleased. She was absolutely right! The hotel is charming, rooms are spacious and clean, great bathroom. Terrific breakfast, they even cater to guests with celiac disease offering gluten free choices. The staff is helpful and kind. I can only say that my first time in Rome was perfect in every way. I will return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Cruptown
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Alexandra for five nights in early October 2010. The hotel exceeded our expectations. I'd been concerned after reading certain negative reviews, but I've come to realize that reviews are subjective and vary based on experience. The Hotel Alexandra was an excellent choice for us. As many have noted, the location is great. It is located on a lovely street with easy access to the metro (Barberini). There are many restaurants close by (we had a wonderful dinner at Cafe Alex out front) and it is easy to walk to all the sights (Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Villa Borghese, etc.). The only sights we took the metro to were the ancient center (Colosseum) and Vatican City. The hotel was clean and quiet. We had a room on the 4th Floor overlooking Via Veneto and had no issue with noise from the street. The room was larger than I expected with a huge bathroom. The furnishings were fine (nothing special) and the bed was acceptable (not has hard as other reviews indicated - I had five great nights of sleep). Service at the hotel was solid, albeit reserved. The front desk staff was able to help with directions, make change, etc. The hotel has a elevator which was appreciated after long days sightseeing. The daily breakfast service was good. There were the usual selections and superb coffee. All in all, Hotel Alexandra comes highly recommended and I'd stay there again without hestitation.

Reviews.Title: “Dolce Vita in Hotel Alexandra”
Reviews.Author: okyalos
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and to be honest, i was concerned because having been again to Rome, it´s well known that hotels are not up to standards. I am not a five star hotel naive and i have stayed in many 5 star hotels around Europe. However, a decent 5 star hotel in Rome can cost more than 500 euro per night, which is too much, being on a business trip. So i picked this one hotel and i was pleasantly suprised. It´s located in Romes prime location, Via Veneto and it´s close to everything. Staff were polite, despite the stereotypes that Italians are rather rude and snob, and there is even a porter boy (man actually). The hotel has a retro style, and although i am not a fan of this style, it´s ok. Breakfast is adequate and there is even a big hall, where you can relax. Rooms are adequate, with some amenities that usually you do not find in 3 star hotels. I read some reviews about the size of the room.If you go to Rome and you spend time in your room, apart from sleeping, then you should not go at first place. Rome is such an amazing city and it´s really pity to discuss about the size of the room. Wrapping up, this is a decent 3 star hotel, which actually feels more like a 4 star hotel. Location is unsurpassed and people there make you feel at home. Rooms are rather indifferent, but bear in mind that yoy are in World´s finest open air museum. I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Dinoalita
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it was the only place with availability due to planning our trip to Rome last minute. Looking at the reviews we were worried it was just going to be average but found it to be above average. For 209 euros a night the rooms could have been a little more "plush" but it was a pretty typical room for Italy standards and Rome is expensive. Kind of small but very clean and quiet. We slept great! The bathroom was a good size and all marble. Shower had no pressure but was nice and warm. We called front desk and asked for robes and slippers which made the stay much nicer. We like to sleep late so never made it to the breakfast room. We did call right about 10 am each morning and had cappucino, oj and croissants delivered to the room. It was great having breakfast in bed (although they will charge 5 euros each morning at check out). The staff was SO helpful and friendly. Everything we requested was brought to our room within minutes with a smile. They also arranged our car service to the airport. The location is great! Walked to all the sites and took the metro to the Vatican. The hotel is only a few feet from the metro making it very convenient! Rome is a beautiful, incredible city!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Vdell
Reviews.Content: Friendly, and helpful staff in a lovely hotel in a perfect location, on Via Veneto. Less than 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and Pantheon. Good breakfast, excellent service. Rooms decorated in antiques, and a confortable size bedroom, marble bathroom. Bus stop across the street. Barberni metro 1 minute walk. Excellent shopping area. Plenty of fine restrurants and coffee bars. $ exchange, tour company steps from hotel. We enjoyed our stay very much in part becasue of the excellent staff and fine service we received. We will stay here again on our next visit. A 3 star hotel with a 5 star attitude. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Central location - trevi spanish step close”
Reviews.Author: Ainsjane
Reviews.Content: We had been in Rome two years previously and had a good idea of the layout. On arrival we were given a map and guide and they marked the location of the hotel on the map. The Alexandra did not disappoint on location - down one of the side street and a turn to the right and we arrived at the top of the spanish steps. A walk down the hill and down to the right, down a side street arriving out side the Spar (good to get a few supplies) you are just a short stroll away from the Trevi. You can then carry on to the Pantheon but while crossing one of the main roads look to your left and you can see the Wedding cake and there are surprises on the way. A walk down the hill and you arrive at the underground which we used to get to the Colloseum. You have to change at the Terminal but its a quick way of getting around. We had booked a guided tour before we arrived with Dark Rome tours - highly recommended. The City sightseing tour buses stop just down the road and again great value of money. The staff at the Hotel were very helpful and even rang to confirm our car booking for our return flight. The rooms are small and a little dated but very clean. All in all a great visit and an excellent hotel. Debs and Steve - Leyland, Lancashire, England

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: janwerks2
Reviews.Content: Was a bit nervous about staying there based on Tripadvisor reviews, but was highly recommended by contact in Rome. We stayed in Room 601 a mini suite with balcony that was beautiful and immaculate. Ash was particularly helpful to us during our stay helping us with local transportation and a rental car. The breakfast and breakfast room staff leave something to be desired but the location and room well compensated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Traditional Italian Hotel worthy of 3stars”
Reviews.Author: joanneStaffordshire
Reviews.Content: I have recently visited this hotel not before reading some of the reviews about it on trip advisor. Yes, they put me off but i consoled myself with the fact that i would only be sleeping there. On arrival the doorman helped us with our luggage and we were checked in quickly. The room we had was large, airconditioned, clean, large bathroom although i am sure there were some rooms in the hotel that were a lot smaller. Breakfast was like any other continental breakfast with little choice but get-by-able. Fantastic Location for everything. Would definately stay here again. 2mins from Hard Rock Cafe.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: OxfordBluem
Reviews.Content: A charming hotel in an excellent location. It was quiet and cool thanks to the double glazing & air conditioning. Our room was a standard room on the front of the hotel. It was beautifuly decorated with antique furniture. It was kept spotlessly clean every day. The en-suite bathroom was large and well appointed. The staff were helpful and friendly. We woud not hesitate in returning and recommending this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Hotel Alexandra and absolutely perfect location to sites”
Reviews.Author: sml41
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one week and I cannot say enough about it. The location is key and perfect walk to the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Spanish Steps and Colliseum; the staff were very helpful, friendly and always there for us. One of our traveling companions was hospitalized prior to us staying here and they went out of their way to assist us with contacting the hospital, taxi, embassy etc due to language issues. We did not speak Italian. The location is close to the metro, bus lines, walking distance , some like the colliseum are a little farther walk so if you have issues walking , you will need other arrangements to that site. We walked everywhere from this location and there are quite a few cafes up and down this street. People in the area were friendly and helpful The news stand is just seconds from the front door where you can buy your bus/metro tickets/phone cards etc. The room was well air conditioned during a heat wave in Rome which was appreciated. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and I did not pick up any noise. It was just a few subway stops to the Vatican from this hotel at 1 euro each way. After a long day of sightseeing and walking, a clean , comfortable bed was all that I needed to go to sleep. We had included breakfast in our plan and the breakfast was sufficient , would like to see them change the menu on some days especially since we were there for a week. We felt more like locals than tourists and it was easy getting around the city. We felt safe, we had no issues with anyone in Rome and I cannot wait to go back. The 5 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain is easy from this location and the streets near the Trevi Fountain are lined with eating places, gift shops etc. I would stay again at this hotel in a heartbeat!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: amybop
Reviews.Content: well after reading the comments left by other people i was very very worried about staying in this hotel. i emailed the manager before going as advised by someones review to ask for a room at the front higher up and it be a standard double. we arrived and thats just what we got. the room u could tell had been redorated in the past few yrs and was big enough for us the only problem was the shower as if you are of a larger size u would not fit in it, but otherwise everything was very clean and was done so every day. the beds are hard so ask for another pillow and your fine. some of the reviews before this just seemed to complain and not try do anything about it we did and the hotel staff were extremely helpful and helped us out with our italian phrasing, it seems you be polite to them and try speak their language they respect and help u DO NOT JUST YELL AT THEM IN YOUR LANGUAGE. the only issue we had was they needed to change the breakfast if u are staying more than 3nights and doing 7 like us they need to change the breakfast but there are many many places to go eat for very little money. would definatly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay At This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathy612
Reviews.Content: Eight of us had reservations for 4 nights - we arrived very early after a long flight to find that four in our group did not have appropriate rooms - we had requested two to a room, but with seperate beds - the office staff was very rude and uncooperative - insisting they did not have those types of accommodations - after much discussion and complaining they "found" appropriate rooms but charged us 50 euros more per night - we had this trip booked and prepaid for months! We are still trying to recover the extra money we had to spend and it is July. One plus is that the location is great.
