We didn't get into any room until later in the afternoon - we were tired, exhausted and hungery. One of the rooms was no bigger than a closet and the bed was a cot! The desk staff was very unfriendly for the remainder of our stay. Do not stay at this hotel. Big disappointment - except for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Please choose another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sofia-Katarina
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations on this hotel as we were recommended by a friend, but the hotel Alexandra fails to live up to its own high standards. It was fairly clean, neatly decorated room with a moldy bathroom and an air condition that didn't work. The staff seems to believe they are working at a five star hotel, but lacks the service... For its price it is not worth the money. On the up side, it has quite a good location, but so does many other hotels in Rome! Do yourselves a favour and find a hotel with more charm and feeling!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Sam13057711
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel. We just returned from Italy and stayed at this hotel for four nights.We paid 450 dollars a night for a junior suite. This hotel is old and in dire need of updating. The furniture in the room was older than I am and the wallpaper was hanging off the walls. The beds felt like sleeping on concrete. The blonde lady at the front desk was not helpful and down right rude. The only good things I can say are the rooms were clean and the hotel was in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had stayed somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: tjsloopy
Reviews.Content: Even though Alexandra Hotel has great location, it does not have great service. During our 3 day stay, we had a room that had obnoxious odor and we had 3 paintings and 2 sketches stolen from us at the hotel. The hotel management refused to acknowledge that there was a problem and did nothing about the theft. No report was filed by the hotel and no offer of resolution. The hotel is beautiful inside,our room was large with a view but the bed was hard, the continental breakfast was mediocre. The loss of our art that was bought in Paris and the hotel's rudeness and unprofessional handling of the situation put a dark spot on an otherwise awesome experience in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “good points, bad points”
Reviews.Author: davandal
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the good points. The room and bathroom were spotlessly clean, as were the common areas. The hotel is in a good location. We walked everywhere, including the Vatican City (50 min). The breakfast had a good choice including a hot option. The bad points. There have been several reviews commenting on the grid in the road at the front of the hotel. We were on the third floor and, even with the window closed, it gave us a very disturbed night as the traffic was relentless. In the morning, we asked to change rooms. One of the 'blond' receptionists was on duty and was very cold and unhelpful, saying it would not be possible as they were fully booked that night. I stood my ground and pointed out that it was early enough notice for them to make a change. Well, they did change us to a room at the back, which, although quieter in terms of traffic noise, was hot and the church bells could be heard chiming every 1/4 hour through the night! Don't bother with the Alex restaurant.The food was mediocre and overpriced. There are loads of better choices in the city. Look out for where the Italians go. We found a lovely trattoria on Via del Tritone ( on the corner). I probably would not recoomend this hotel as we did not get a decent nights sleep and with all the walking you do, you need it! It did not spoil our experience of this fantastic city, though!

Reviews.Title: “It was alright, but not superb”
Reviews.Author: MrsBee711
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near a subway stop and a short walk from the Trevi Fountain/Spanish Steps, so location-wise, it's great. We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel room, which had no art on the walls and a water stain on the ceiling. Internet was available in their lounge, but we had a lot of trouble connecting (we ended up being charged for two hours when we were barely able to connect for half an hour). Certain staff members were helpful and seemed pleased to see us - others made us feel like we were bothering them. The breakfast was great and based on the location, I'd still recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...but VERY hard beds”
Reviews.Author: Kleigh2
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 days in October 2009 with my Mom for a short vacation. The hotel was nice and quiet. Room: we had room 505. I marked the room 3 out of 5 because of the beds!! It was very quiet, and large for a European room. About the size of a typical room in a house in the states. The room was only loud if the window was open, but once you shut it, it was quiet. There is a grate right in front of the hotel so as cars drive over it you can hear it. but when the window is closed you can only hear it if you are paying attention to it. The bed was extremely hard. My mom looked underneath the sheets to see if it was just a box spring. Just think of staying at your grandparents house and sleeping on there hard bed, it is WAY worse. I took 4 blankets folded them up and slept on them and it still felt like i was sleeping on the floor. Absolutely the worst bed i have ever laid in by far. The bathroom was a good size, a little over average for a European hotel room. The toilet is really close to the wall. I am an average girl about 175 lbs and my right leg was touching the wall, that's how close it is. The breakfast, is cereal, scrambled eggs, cooked ham, bread rolls, juice, fruit, and cheese. It gets old after the second day. But not that bad. The staff was very friendly and spoke English. Location: GREAT!! it is about a 5 min walk to the Spanish steps and the Trevii Fountain (don't know how to spell it) and 10 mins to the Pantheon. I would say it is about a 20 min walk to ancient Rome. The only place we did not walk to is the Vatican. It was the 4th stop on the metro. The metro is right down the street, about a 30 second walk from the hotel. You cant get a better location for the money!! You can literally walk every ware in the city if you are in decent shape. I have a bad back and i walked the whole city. But wear comfortable shoes! Other: Don't be alarmed to walk at night...there are people all over the place at all hours of the night. But every one starts to come out at about 6pm to the fountain and the Pantheon with ice cream in hand. Be prepared to spend all day at the Vatican. We were there from 9:30am to 5pm and did not see everything. Watch out for people trying to steal your bag or wallet. Nothing happened to us, but pay attention to people bumping into you..that is when they will take your wallet or purse. As for drinks...very expensive... about 3 euro for a coke. Overall: Very good location...but VERY HARD BEDS. i would stay there again if they got new beds. Or if i brought a sleeping bag!

Reviews.Title: “Managing your expectations”
Reviews.Author: Sparrow00
Reviews.Content: On the plus side the location was A1 and we found the breakfast to be very reasonable. On the negative side, the noise from the grid in Via De Venitto is very tiresome; the room was old, small and simple with no mod cons (except the TV!), bathroom was functional (just don't try turning around without looking first), air con started working at 0720 every morning - why?; watch out for the older of the two blond receptionists who must have recently failed the prison officer interview but should try the special forces interrogation unit where she would fit in perfectly - the younger one was just lovely and recommended a wonderful restaurant that didn't require a second mortgage - a rarity in Rome. Try and find a more modern hotel that isn't resting so heavily on its past laurels and location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good base for sight seeing,”
Reviews.Author: kimswimin
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, providing an exellent location. Staff very helpful. Room small but very clean. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and basic but good hotel”
Reviews.Author: smileysheep11
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is first class, 5 minute walk from the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. There is a metro station less than 200 yards away as well. The room was small but provided all the essentials for a short break in Rome. Staff were helpful and always said hello. Breakfast was again basic but provided everything that we needed. The Alex restaurant outside (10% discount for hotel guests) served delicious carbonara.Overall this hotel is well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to enjoy Rome”
Reviews.Author: Dmitrysky
Reviews.Content: We stay here every time we are in Rome (each summer since 2006). Location is perfect to explore Rome sights as well as to make shopping. It is just a little too far to get to Vatican but still you can get there on foot. The hotel is situated in Via Vittorio Venetto which is a quite place although very popular leisure attraction for the celebrities of the 1950's. The rooms are nice but sometimes tiny (so are the bathrooms) due to the building layout itself. We did not pay too much attention to the small defects of the furniture because first it is authentic and second the location pays well for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ThePenkhullPotter
Reviews.Content: Located approx 100 metres from the tube station and within easy walking distance for nearly all the major sights, this is a great place to stay, we had a very enjoyable break in Rome and would not hesitate to recommend this Hotel to our friends. The staff were pleasant and the room (standard double) was more than adequate. The breakfast was fine and there was a reasonable choice. The only place we did not walk to was Vatican City, and that is 2 stops away on the tube. The only reason I have not given a clean sweep on the ratings is we had a front room and there was a grill in the road outside our room which rattled every time a vehicle drove over it, not the Hotels fault I know but it was loud even with the windows shut. We would not hesitate to stay here again if we decided to come back to Rome. Thank you for a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location within walking distance of lots of sights”
Reviews.Author: Mysty1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexandra Hotel for four nights. The best thing about the hotel is the location. It is in a good neighbourhood (opposite the US embassy) - the Trevi Fountain is a 5 minute walk away and the Colosseum is a 20 minute walk away. If you are not keen on walking there is a metro station just outside the hotel. The hotel rooms are dated but are clean with air conditioning which is a must for Rome in June. On the down side, the reception staff were very aloof. Overall good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very inhospitable hotel wiht impolite staff”
Reviews.Author: d4etver
Reviews.Content: To be honest - we were disappointed wiht the hotel in Italy for the first time. We have spent 14 days in that terrible hotel. The reseptionists were impolite and arrogant . While having breakfast we were shocked with bad-mannered waiter (a hindu). Every morning he was clattering the cups and dishes. The breakfast was ok, but was not various, coffee was tastless and cold. They had problems with air conditioned. You have to phone them 2 or 3 times and only then they switched on their old air conditioned system. Also the bath was old. We were satisfied only with the location of the hotel and NOTHING MORE.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK, but not any more than that”
Reviews.Author: EdandJane
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time at this hotel. Great location on Via Venito. Short walk to Spanish Steps etc. We were a difficult booking - 2 rooms for 5 persons (3 sons 21-26 yrs). They gave us a 2 room suite with 3 beds in bedroom and converted sofa bed. It got the job done but no more. Front desk and breakfast staff not warm but not surly either. Just average. Bathroom was very basic, narrow tub/shower. If it were the two of us, we've outgrown such average digs. But you're in Rome for the city and this got the job done. I wouldn't rate anything below average except the personnel could use a refresher that they are in the people serving business.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with Great location in Rome,Italy”
Reviews.Author: Ed275
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three days after a trans-atlantic cruise.Great location!Walk to Trevi Fountain. Caught city tour bus across the street.Next to Metro station. Clean and updated rooms. Quiet.Nice breakfast every morning.Lot's of restaurants and shopping within walking distance.Would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “big room, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: donstefano
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a giant room at the front of the hotel. Very nicely decorated and clean. The windows have special glass fitted that keeps the street noise out. Almost next to the metro station and in walking distance from many tourist hotspots, so very convenient. Good breakfast (though not the most elaborate I have seen - sufficient choice though) As I didn't pay myself, I can't decide about value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but old fashioned and very small.”
Reviews.Author: nannyredcar
Reviews.Content: In an expensive eating part of Rome. Read menus VERY carefully! Room small but cleaned daily. Staff helpful. Very old fashioned hotel- some may like ambiance. Rome is a beautiful city if viewed from above, but very hectic street walking. Take on/off open top bus and chill and get to know city.

Reviews.Title: “Great for solo tourists”
Reviews.Author: Sashul
Reviews.Content: Right to business: its a GREAT hotel for its value, location is amazing, BUT its pretty small - rooms are perfect for ONE. If you plan on going for a romantic vacation and a bit shy about hanging your panties in the bathroom, then its not quite for you. Traveling alone or with long-time partner - definitely go for it! This hotel was owned by the same family since XIX century, thus the rooms are decorated nicely and the hotel itself is home-like. If you want to have Wi-Fi in the room ask for it beforehand, as not in all rooms you get reception. All in all staff is friendly and helpful. One more thing about location: its right in front of a subway station (rare case in Rome) so if you don't want to spend money on taxi and go see ancient Rome by yourself, then its p-e-r-f-e-c-t for you!

Reviews.Title: “hotel Alexandra in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LindaCyprus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this 3 star hotel on 22nd of Dec. for 4 nights. Very clean and the service was excellent as we complained about the noise of the railings on the street and we were upgraided to a large room with a jaccuzi at the back of the hotel. There was plenty for breakfast :eggs, bacon, cakes croissants cereals etc.and open from 6.45 to 10.30am. It is 1 min walk to the Barberini underground station with plenty of good restaurants nearby. I would definitely stay there again. I would suggest you make clear at time of booking whether you want no smoking, quiet room and large bathroom as our teenage kids had a small shower room .

Reviews.Title: “The Alexandra is a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: StumpyB
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel Alexandra for a party of 8 friends and everyone was extremely pleased with the hotel. The email communications were very good, the reception staff couldn't have been more helpful and the breakfasts were amazing. My party had 4 rooms and the rooms all seemed to be of equal size - they're not as small as I'd thought after reading other reviews - this is Rome after all - really old buildings can't provide the size of rooms most Americans expect. The bathrooms did vary in size but I noted that my friend who was 50 was given a very large bathroom, with bath, and a lovely bottle of prosecco was waiting for her in her room. The reception staff found us the cheapest transfer back to the airport and our luggage was kept secure until we were ready to leave. The check-out time of midday is also alot more acceptable than the usual 10am. I would definitely recommend this hotel - the location is great too. And if the Euro had of been a bit kinder on the £ it would have been a steal at the internet rate of 144 Euros per double room per night. But it was still great value!

Reviews.Title: “Location Good for this Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: millermaid
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome. Stayed at Hotel Alexandra for 3 nights. Pros: Location is close to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, metro and also nice walking routes to many other areas, like the Borghese Park/Gallery. The people at the front desk were not great to very good, depending on who was at the desk. The Bellman was extremely kind and helpful, which is always so appreciated. Breakfast was the best we experienced in Rome, but if you are comparing it to American, don't expect too much. Room was very clean. Cons: When we arrived they showed us to a room that was just awful. I couldn't believe they expected us to use it (Room 106 I believe). They tried to tell us that it was a standard room and that's what we paid for. We asked if they had a room in the "standard" category that was nicer and they showed us to a room that was much better. Had to wait another hour for it to get cleaned, but it was well worth it. Bathroom, as you read about in Europe, was the typical very small bathroom, but was our least favorite of all our stays in Italy (also visited Florence and Venice). If you are a light sleeper, ask for a room on the inside. We were told it is not included in the "standard" rate room. We faced the street and the street had a metal grate which, when cars drove over, made a clanging noise. Pretty much got used to it, but not completely! Overall, would say this hotel is good/fair. As is mentioned in many of these posts, hotels in Europe are small and not the kinds we are used to in the States. So just be prepared for that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Look NO Further”
Reviews.Author: TNlovestotravel
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a wonderful stay in Rome. We stayed at the Hotel Alexandra for five nights. We had two rooms, a "deluxe double" and a "standard double". The deluxe double was our room (room #263). While smaller than US standards, it was an excellent size compared to other hotels we have stayed in in Europe. The king size bed was two singles made into one (which did leave a line in the middle, a bit more padding there might have made the difference) and while a litle harder than I like, was adequate after a long day. It was very nicely decorated with a great television, which included satellite tv. The closet had mirrored doors and plenty of room for all of our things. We did have a small balcony which was greatly appreciated because I think now all hotels in Rome are "non-smoking" and when I commented upon this at check-in, the front desk attendant was more than accomodating (sympathetic perhaps?), telling me that we could smoke on the balcony "because we would be outside" and even brought us an ashtray to keep there. The bathroom was marvelous by European standards (still comparing to other previously stayed in hotels in Europe) with a great bathtub for long soaks after long days and a hand held shower attachment for quick showers in the morning. The pedestal sink had enough room to set things on the side along with a small table with room enough for all our toiletries. Our son's room (329) was a standard double, and while not as roomy as ours, was fine for them. Their bathroom only had a stand up shower and no balcony, but it also had a closet. The breakfast was great with scrambled eggs, bacon, pastries, frest fruit, cereral, all laid out in a very appetizing way and a perfect start to the mornings before setting out on a long day. Great money-saving feature of this hotel. The hotel staff was very nice. They helped us get anywhere we wanted to go with directions, where to get things we needed (our luggage was lost). Anything we asked of them was met with a smile. It was much appreciated. THE BEST PART OF THIS HOTEL is the LOCATION. The Metro stop "Barberini" is at the bottom of the small hill the street is on, and the bus stop is right around the corner from that. The Spanish steps and the Tivoli fountain are within walking distance (just ask at the desk, they will point you in the right direction) and all other attractions were either a short Metro trip or bus ride away. I would recommend buying a three day "all transport" card to make traveling around very easy. I am a bit of a nosy-nellie, and when we left our room one day the maid was cleaning the room next to ours (262) she allowed me to peek in and look at it. She said it was a room for parents with children. It was larger with a king size bed and a couch which folded out into a bed with a bathroom like ours. If I was staying with little ones, it would be perfect. It did face the front of the hotel with two windows and the maid said it was "noisier" but windows close and its a fairly quiet street. All in all, if and when we go back to Rome, this is where we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved LOVED Hotel Alexandra - November 2007”
Reviews.Author: ElissaUSA
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alexandra was PEFECT (November 2007). We were a little worried about mixed TA reviews, but we had a mini-suite that was GORGEOUS (with large modern bathroom that had a Jacuzzi tub and half glass enclosure for the hand-held-mounted shower). The location of the hotel on the Via Veneto in the Barbarini area was spectacular and easy to find - on the same block as a major Metro station and walking distance to everything except the Vatican, which was a quick 3 stop ride. The staff was charming and helpful, and breakfast was first class and amazing (we're still thinking about that breakfast in the beautiful breakfast room that felt like an outdoor garden indoors -- fresh breads, cakes, cereals, hot scrambled eggs, meats, cheeses, yogurt, fresh fruit, fresh fruit salad, cappucino served to the table). As reported by other TA writers, the beds were hard, but that was GOOD. We booked the room directly with the hotel via email from their website with no problems. Perhaps the trick is to go off-season; the hotel was quiet, rather empty and just perfect. We would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: suejock
Reviews.Content: great location - clean but small rooms. bathroom just tolerable due to smallness. shower really small - curtain sticks to you while showering. sink is in way of toilet!

Reviews.Title: “loved via Veneto”
Reviews.Author: prada30
Reviews.Content: So, I decided to visit Rome for the first time during Easter this year..Unluckily, the orthodox Easter (Im Greek orthodox) coincided with the catholic, and the streets where really really crowded after good friday... I had booked hotel alexandra mainly for its location (beginning of Via Veneto), after researching the whole rome hotel scene for endless hours on my pc... So, here the details: Our room was on the back, which meant it was really small (adequete space just for 2 suitcases -one in the open closet- and barely walking around), but also very quiet. after 10 hours of everyday walking, you really need a deep sleep. The room was really old (as the whole hotel), somewhat revovated, but at least clean, with wooden floors (cleaner than a carpet) and a clean bathroom (although we only had a stable faucet up in the shower, which meant BIG trouble in washing). Anyhow, I loved Via Veneto, Piazza Barberini was 50 meters away and using the bus was very practical and easy!!! The staff was mostly helpful, totally English speaking and ok, apart from 2 exceptions.. The breakfast continental, standard things, but tasty and nothing was missing. I really recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Location - close”
Reviews.Author: TravelGo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Alexandra with my boyfriend in August, 2005. The best thing about this hotel is its location. It's across the street from Barberini metro line and also a few minute walk from Stazione Centrale. In addition if you fly into Ciampino Airport (like we did) and take a bus into city center, the bus stop is right across from the hotel. Rooms and service are average. It's a good value hotel and overall our stay in Hotel Alexandra was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Good Location”
Reviews.Author: marketwatch
Reviews.Content: During our recent stay at this hotel, I found the hotel to be clean, adequate and above all a great location! I agree with the 3 star rating and cannot imagine what happened with previous guests who had negative comments. Breakfast was good, room was pleasantly , not lavishly decorated. We are seasoned travellers and know what to expect in Europe. Nothing measures up to American Standards except American chains. In Italy the style of rooms are more conservative in decoration. Yes, I will agree that the front desk staff are aloof, but again this is Italians. If you are very nice to them, they are very nice to you. I will totally stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK! Read on why...”
Reviews.Author: Dupont_10
Reviews.Content: Low end of a top notch location. The junior suite is OK at best, wallpaper hanging, lamps falling apart. The bathroom is a joke. I had better in a Cairo three-star. Breakfast is boring and tasteless (the worst scarmbled eggs in my life). I had a one-of a-kind watch stolen from the room, the woman at the reception was less than helpful. She did not beleive me, then said I could call the police if I wanted to..!!??? I had to repeatedly ask her to call the porter who was in our room to close the shutters, if he knew anything. (No one asked if we wanted this service anyway.) It looked as if they just did not care, just told us that they have worked with the same people for a long time. Maybe they should not have. Bad moment of an otherwise great honeymoon. Remember, this hotel cost 520 EU for two nights, with a major discount. Very bad deal!!! I am sure Rome has a lot more to offer. The breakfast area is small, the decor is half way between tasteless-tacky and heavy kietsch. Our room was dark, had to keep the lights on all the time. The picture you see was taken 10 am... This is a hotel I seriously do NOT reccomend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: melkb
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 wonderful weeks in Italy. However, our stay at the Hotel Alexandra in Rome was the BIG disappointment of the trip. Our travel agent assured us the Hotel Alexandra was rated as a three-star hotel, but we certainly don't agree. Although the hotel is located on the Via Veneto--an address known for upscale shops (the Lamborghini dealership is across the street), the Alexandra is very run-down. The upholstered furniture in the lobby is threadbare and the wall-paper in the first room we were given was stained and coming off the walls. Our second room had a bathroom the size of a broomcloset. If you're considering Rome, don't consider the Hotel Alexandra. It's definitely not what it bills itself to be and NOT worth the price they charge for a trendy address.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal choice for comfort, price and location.”
Reviews.Author: revlis123
Reviews.Content: Our party of four adults stayed in one of the Junior Suites in this charming and well appointed hotel for four nights. The large double room provided comfortable accomodation, was clean, well furnished and surprisingly quiet. The staff were all very friendly and were able to provide for all our comfort needs during our stay. The Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps are within easy walking distance, as are the Hard Rock Caf'e and red line Metro which connects to the Central station. I would happily recommend this Hotel to those seeking a reasonably priced, central base from which to explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: sandyplace
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Italy and found the Alexandra to be as good a choice as (if not better then) many hotels in Italy. The reception staff while aloof was polite. The porters, breakfast and housekeeping staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was average size for most European hotels in older city buildings. It was clean and kept very cool considering the near 100 degree weather outside. Our 4th floor room faced the street and we did not hear much noise from outside. We were there the day Italy won the World Cup and actually kept the windows open to hear the revelry that went on through the night. The breakfast was very good and internet access ok. As mentioned below, the access to taxi, bus and metro service is a real plus. If you stay here, don't miss the Crypt of the Capuchins across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alexandra...not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed in Hotel Alexandra for 4 nights in May. We were constantly kept awake at night from the grid outside the window, so if you are booking here request a room at the back. The room was very small, so small that the bathroom had a sliding door, (obviously to save space). The cleaning staff were very good as was the porter, but the reception staff were rude, unhelpful and generally made us feel that we were not welcome. I certainly won't be making a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't reccomend”
Reviews.Author: clairebear123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Alexandra for 4 nights in May. The hotel was in a good location on the Via Veneto easy for Termini and the metro. The room we stayed in was "deluxe", I realise that European city rooms are small, but this was small, shabby and had a view of an alley. We found that the reception staff were inefficient, rude and inept. At one point I was speaking to a member of the reception staff and they cut me off to deal with another customer, I saw this happen to someone else so it seemed to be the norm. I have never met reception staff so rude in all of my travels around the world. I had few dealings with the staff, eg. asking for directions, asking for the room key etc. and they dealt with me with contempt. I would say that the cleaning staff were superd and did a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Total Dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: Dublintripper
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a large wedding party. The room that myself and my boyfriend were given was on the first floor at the back, overlooking an alleyway. The room was extremely small, not at all like it was advertised in their brochure. The wallpaper was peeling of the walls, the shower leaked, the airconditioning was broken, and the furniture was grubby. We asked to be moved to a different room and were told that this would be possible, only to be told later that they had no room for us. This happened on three separate occasions. The only saving grace about the room was that we were not kept awake by the loose grate at the front of the hotel, which kept any members of the wedding party that were located there awake. Having read reviews about the hotel and that the front was noisy, my sister requested a room in the back for our grandparents but this request was not fulfilled. The reception staff were the worst that I have ever encountered in a hotel. They took no responsibilty for any problems that related to anything that they had organised for the wedding. I was made to feel like a nuisance when I made the simple request for some new towels to be brought to my room, since none had been brought for three days. On a number of occasions I was left standing at reception waiting for a key, being ignored by the recptionist, as where many other members of the party. They did not want to know about any problems. The breakfast was good and the breakfast staff and the porter were pleasant and helpful. However due to the bad service and the room conditions I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: samburu001
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alexandra is definitely worth looking into if you're going to be staying in Rome. The room price includes a full American breakfast plus all taxes, so the price you're quoted when making a reservation is the price you'll pay when checking out. The hotel is on the Via Veneto and across the street from the Barberini stop on the "A" line of the Metro. It's a perfect location for getting around by foot, Metro, bus or train. Although a couple of the Alexandra desk clerks we dealt with over the week we were there left a little to be desired, most of the staff was great -- especially the housekeeping staff we never saw, but who kept our room immaculate!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & excellent value for the weekend visitor”
Reviews.Author: JAG72
Reviews.Content: When looking for a hotel in Rome I wanted somewhere that was centrally located, reasonably priced and clean, and the Hotel Alexandra fitted the bill on all 3 counts. If you decide to stay here, you should definitely take heed of the warning given in other reviews on this site, and request a room on the back of the hotel. We did and it was blissfully quiet, when sitting in a cafe on the front you are constantly bugged by the noise of the grate outside. The room itself was small and fairly dark, but the bed was comfortable, the bathroom clean and we were only staying 3 nights. Anyway this is Rome, so much to see and do, and so much good food to eat and wine to drink, that spending time in your room is a waste! The staff were friendly enough but not overly helpful when we were trying to work out how best to get to Sorrento. (2 stops on the Metro to Termini, train to Naples, purhcasing tickets at the railway station on the day, and then another train to Sorrento - all pretty straightforward). Breakfasts were modest but there was enough food to get you going in the morning and the location was excellent. The open top tour bus stopped directly opposite the hotel, the metro station was about 30 seconds walk away and you are within walking distance of most of the main tourist attractions. (We did catch the metro to the Vatican but more to save our feet on our final day in Rome). We had a lovely meal in Il Chianti - this restaurant it situated near the Trevi fountain (if you are looking at the fountain, take the road directly on your right hand side - it is situated a little way up on the left). Excellent food and you can sit outside (recommend that you book though). Also as a treat we went to La Terrazza bar at the top of the Hotel Eden (5 mins walk from the hotel). The cocktails were ridiculously expensive (£10 each) but you got lots of lovely nibbles and a fantastic view across Rome. We went as the sun was setting. If you are really pushing the boat out I have friends who recommend the restaurant there too, but with food and drinks they paid somewhere in the region of £200!! My final tip would be getting to the hotel from the airport. We chose to get a bus from the airport to Termini and then a taxi from Termini. The bus cost 9 euros each and we thought that this would save money on the taxi fare, but the taxi was 28 euros (I've been told a taxi from the airport would only have been 40 in total - we paid 46). I didn't know at the time that had we taken the metro from termini to barberini we would have paid 2 euros and been so close to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing in many respects”
Reviews.Author: Angel1968
Reviews.Content: We spent a lot of time researching before we booked this hotel for our 3 night stay in Rome, but I have to say we were disappointed with what we got for our money. We arrived late at night to a reception that was less than friendly and who denied all responsibility for (or even knowledge of) the taxi that they had said they would arrange to pick us up from Ciampino. As soon as we arrived in the room we were disappointed. Unlike the pictures on their website, the room was dark, small (but adequate), decorated with very 'busy' and oldfashioned wallpaper that did nothing to add to the size of the room. The television did work, but had a bit missing. All of these we could have lived with. What really caused the problem was the street noise: the room was at the front of the hotel and looked onto the Via Veneto. A busy street at all times of the day and night - and with some kind of metal grid built into it which made a horrendous noise every time a vehicle went over it. Sleep was well nigh impossible. Added to this, hot water appeared to be in short supply - and non-existant in the washbasin! We complained the next morning and asked to be moved to a quieter room. The request was met with some sympathy, but all the quieter rooms were full. To their credit, they did move us to a room at the back of the hotel for the last night of our stay. Not only was the new room quieter, it was also decorated in a much more modern style. If we'd had that room from the start, this would have been a much more positive review. Breakfast was well below average. At 9am (clearly the most popular time) the staff were struggling to cope and the buffet was almost empty. We had to ask every morning for basic items to be replenished. On the positive side, the hotel was spotlessly clean, the beds were comfortable and the staff were generally very polite and helpful. It was close to the Spanish Steps and there were plenty of restaurants within walking distance. We wouldn't stay there again and wouldn't recommend it unless you are guaranteed a room away from the front of the hotel. After all, the main thing you need from a hotel when you're visiting Rome is a good night's sleep so you can cope with the siteseeing!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be going back (despite the rain)!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 day break and our twin room with double bed was excellent, the bathroom being big enough for a small party on it's own. The room was kept spotless and nothing we requested of the staff was a problem - from trousers being pressed to a taxi to the airport. Someone was requesting a larger room as we booked in so perhaps not all the accommodation is/was to the standard we enjoyed, for that reason I'll keep the room number to myself!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the photos and ratings on-line, we were really looking forward to our stay at Hotel Alexandra. Luckily we were out and about most of our four days in Rome as our room at this hotel measured 9 1/2 ft. by 9 1/2 ft. with a bathroom the size of a closet, and with 4 suitcases for our 3-week vacation, we could barely move around! We believe it was actually a Single room they gave us as a Double. The staff was alright but not very helpful. The positives for this hotel were the nice Breakfast Room and delicious breakfast, and the excellent location on beautiful Via Veneto. We would only recommend this hotel if you can get a guarantee of an adequately-sized room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: suemLancashire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break to Rome staying in the Hotel Alexandra. Having read previous reviews I asked for a room on the quiet side of the hotel, with a terrace if possible. Thats exactly what we got. Our room was on the 5th floor and very quiet, it was not small, had a lovely bathroom and a small private terrace. Breakfast was ok, but not great. Its positioned well - the metro is a few yards away, the open top bus tour of Rome stops outside, as do all the other buses and the small electric bus.The Spanish Steps are a few minutes away walking. There are a lot of restaurants nearby, in all price ranges. We had a good meal at Tulio (moderate/expensive) and even better at Il Giardino (moderate). Both within 5 minutes walk of the hotel. If you are near Campo Di Fiori, a wonderful Restaurant is Al Bric (moderate/expensive)- the menu is in Italian but they are happy to translate!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: jamoss
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from rome and the hotel alexandra. The location of the hotel is excellent with plenty of places to eat nearby. The metro is literally two minutes walk away from the hotel. Our room was a bit dated but clean and comfortable and after all, we were out all day discovering the wonderful city of Rome. Breakfast was fine we thought although we only ate continental food. If your room is on the street side, it is very noisy with the grate and the constant traffic, but if you shut all the windows and shutters, it isnt that bad. Rooms could do with a colour tv and tea/coffee making facilities, but apart from that, no problems. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel in an eternal city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was in Italy for two weeks, and the Alexandra was by far the best hotel I stayed in. It is on the very exclusive Via Veneto, yet it is not very expensive compared to its neighbors. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They gave suggestions on eating and assisted us in getting to the airport and around town. The breakfast was great and the facilities were simple, but in great condition. The location is a bit separated from most of the attractions in Rome, but if you don't mind walking or using the Metro, its not all a problem. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “best holiday ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently visited Hotel Alexandra in July. As a young couple in our twenties we found the hotel to be very good. when we first arrived we were greeted by a butler who carried our luggage up many stairs and then to our room. we found the staff very pleasant and helpful when it came to any enquiries or booking taxis and tours. The hotel is based on one of the most elegant streets in Rome, packed with resturants and shops etc. The room was quite small but if you are touring and walking all day all you need is somewhere to stay at night. The hotel is 5 minutes walk from the Trevi fountain and the Spanish steps and half an hour to forty minutes from the vatican, definetly worth the walk. Many of the restuarants on the Via Venteto were extremley expensive but if you want to splash out this is the place to go. On the other hand their is a beautiful chinese resturant in one off the side streets beside the Trevi fountain, would defiently reccomend that. The street hotel alexandra is on, is very safe, buses appeared every five minutes and there was an undergrounds 3o feet away. For young or old couples Rome is defiently the place to be, it is so romantic. My boyfriend and I hope to return to Rome and when we do we will most defiently be staying at hotel Alexandra. Bronach loves Christopher....Xxx

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Woody01
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is ideally located about 10 mins walk from Spanish Steps. Rooms are small and furnished traditionally. Very comfortable though. If you need anything you just need to ask, staff go out of their way to help you. I'd definitely recommend to others and would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Great times were had”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the fortune to be booked into this hotel without knowing anything about it. Nor did I know anything about the Via Veneto. I was delighted to find that I was staying in a hotel on an exclusive street and how close it was to everything I wanted to see. I found the staff to be friendly and kind and helpful. They quickly learned my room number and had my key to hand me before I could tell them. I had a great conversation with one of the staff about my son (who's photo he spotted when he brought me another pillow). My room was a good size for a single. Breakfast was ok. The scrambled eggs were a bit cool but the bacon was fine. Mind you I did eat early so if you were late in the eggs would have been cold. I ate croissants or rolls with meat. Or cereal with yoghurt. It was all good. I guess if the only thing wrong was the fact that I didnt want to watch CNN or the BBC then I had fun redubbing movies I've seen in English from Italian back to English. It was most amusing. I even liked the way that if I left my window open they would come in and close it before it was late to keep the cool air out. I'd go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cas1905
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Alexandra in Rome, Italy from 5/6 through 5/10. Upon arrival, there was apparently a problem with our room, according to the gentleman behind the desk; but they gave us their suite. We were supposed to move to our standard double room the next day. The suite was very nice with a private balcony. Also very clean. The next day when we came back from sightseeing, we were prepared for our regular room and imagine our suprise when we were told that we were to stay in the suite the entire stay (for no addition charge). The staff seemed very knowledgeable and accomodating. Cab ride from the hotel to Termini was 6 Euro's. Breakfast buffet was fine and we liked the fact that they started serving at 06:45. Location was great. It was approximately 100 feet from Plaza Barberini and the Metro. There were plenty of restaurants and outside cafes to eat at including Hard Rock Cafe. Lastly, we considered this area very safe and never felt "ill at ease" in the evening. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel over 4 and 5 star alternatives based on previous reviews and its location - RESULT! I definately made the right choice. We arrived early at the hotel (1130am). However we were checked in immediately without question. Staff were friendly and helpful and can arrange any excursions. We'd pre booked ours in the UK and the receptionist rang the tour company to arrange for us to be collected from the hotel. Although the room was the smallest we've ever stayed in it was immaculately clean, the decor was nice and the white marble bathroom had a fabulous large power shower with extra wall mounted body jets. Our room was toward the back and was comfortably cool and quiet (day and night). Communal areas are basic, but pleasant enough and breakfast was simple, but adequate. The location was superb, we had a good map and walked to the Coloseum and Roman Forum ruins (about 1.5 - 2 miles), Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and Piazza Popollo (10 - 15mins). With lots of cafe bars and restaurants right on your doorstep you needn't venture far on an evening, however we had a change of scenery a couple of evenings (the Spanish Steps are buzzing at night), we stuck to main roads and felt completely safe. Would we stay here again - DEFINATELY, only next time we'd stay for longer - 4 days just isn't long enough to see this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, loved this property”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Alexandra in September and would definately stay again. It was very quaint, typical Italian, which I love when I travel to different countries, well maintained and comfortable. It is a 100 year old building but has been remodeled and is very good condition. There were two couples traveling together and both our rooms were nice, but different in their design and furnishings. The rooms were decent sized for a European hotel, bathrooms were nice and modern, and there was more than ample storage space. This hotel is centrally located on Via Veneto, and convenient to walk to the historical monuments in Rome. It is near the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and easy walking distance to the Forum, and Collisium. There is a subway stop within 1/4 block of the hotel as well. We walked to most of the historical sites and then took the subway back to the hotel. The staff at the hotel arranged for our transfers both from the airport and to our cruise ship when we departed. I arranged this from the states before we left via EMail. They were very helpful with local information and answered many questions we had for them. We felt we received good value for our money and this included a hot, tasty breakfast on site. I would not hesitate to recommend this property to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed here for three nights in November. The location is fantastic literally outside the tube station, Barberini. The street itself is busy but quite nice, a Lambourghini garage opposite! The rooms are cosy and not bad size. The decor is a little dated and some of the wall paper was peeling, but thats hardly a reason not to stay. The staff were very polite and helpful and friendly. Breakfast was a buffet style, with scrambled eggs, bacon, bread, cereal, fruit etc. quite a good variety. One word of warning, rooms at the front overloooking the street do suffer fro noise generated by a large grate on the road, when cars drive over it it makes a terrific noise and this goes on ALL night!! we used earplugs! Overall an exellent place to stay, highl recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five days from 20 July. The hotel is in a beautiful location with plenty of cafes to drink beer and people watch. Hard Rock Cafe is five minutes up the street. We were able to check in at 1pm before the published check in time. The room was small but we expected that based on other reviews, but you spend so much time outside all you need is a cool room to crash in at the end of the day. However we loved the quaintness of the room with its romantic lighting. The marble bathroom was great and the shower was so good with two shower heads and full body jets down the wall that we wanted to bring it home (plenty of room for two!) The metro station is just down the road perfect for all those sightseeing trips. On the negative side the service at reception is not great. There seemed to be about 4 people working on the tiny reception at one time and each one does not know what the other one is doing. On arriving in Rome you have to surrender your passports for a police check and then sign a form later on in the day when they have been checked. We didn't know this and were telephoned at about 7pm to sign these forms. We asked if tomoroow morning was ok as we'd had a long day and it seemed this was ok. However we were then woken up at 11.30pm by a frantic receptionist as the forms had to be signed by midnight. As you can imagine we were not impressed. The following morning a different receptionist asked my boyfriend on the way out if we were checking out that morning. What a cheek we had only checked in the previous afternoon. Apart from those hiccups we had a fabulous time!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Judging by the previous reviews I wonder if I am talking about the same hotel... The only good thing about this hotel it's its location. The rooms are extremely small and dated plus on the first night we were eaten by mosquitoes. The breakfast was of very poor quality... for 148 Euro per night I felt robbed.

Reviews.Title: “A good possibility”
Reviews.Author: Throbbert
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location near the subway, the Spanish Steps, the Fountain of Trevi, and the Colesseum. It is well-maintained and had a relatively friendly staff. It was a bit noisy as there was construction going on (hammering early in the morning) but this was our only complaint. It was clean and affordable for Rome standards.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Sandylutz
Reviews.Content: We took a 25th anniversary trip to Rome in April, and spent 4 nights at the Hotel Alexandra. We couldn't have asked for a more perfect place. It's right on the Via Veneto and we had one of two rooms that has a balcony looking over the street. A couple of the nights we were there, we sat on the balcony and watched all of the activity on the streets. The street curves downhill there, and it's fun to watch all of the Italian scooters, midget cars and huge tourist busses come streaking down the street, not to mention all the people congregating and eating at the enclosed sidewalk restaurants. We like to jog in the mornings, and it's great because the Villa Borghese (kind of the Central Park of Rome) is only a couple of blocks away. Many attractions are in walking distance -- Spanish Steps, for example. And, there's a subway stop less than a block away -- we used it to go to the Vatican and the Coliseum. There are tons of restaurants, gelato shops and retail shops in the area. Clearly, people love to eat at the sidewalk cafes on the Via Veneto, and to have a room with a balcony there was just the best. I thought the breakfast was just fine also -- egss, bacon, pastries, cereal, juices -- really almost anything you would want.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Alexandra
HotelInfo.Address: Via Vittorio Veneto 18, 00187 Rome, Italy
